dinofact.Name: Aardonyx
dinofact.Description: An early stage in the evolution of sauropods.

dinofact.Name: Bactrosaurus
dinofact.Description: One of the earliest of the duck-billed dinosaurs.

dinofact.Name: Camarasaurus
dinofact.Description: The most common sauropod of Jurassic North America.

dinofact.Name: Camarillasaurus
dinofact.Description: A ceratosaur of early Cretaceous western Europe.

dinofact.Name: Cumnoria
dinofact.Description: It was once mistakenly classified as a species of Iguanodon.

dinofact.Name: Dacentrurus
dinofact.Description: The first stegosaur ever to be described.

dinofact.Name: Daemonosauru 0s
dinofact.Description: This "evil lizard" was a close relative of Coelophysis.

dinofact.Name: Dahalokely
dinofact.Description: A rare theropod from the island of Madagascar.

dinofact.Name: Dakotaraptor
dinofact.Description: This giant raptor was recently discovered in South Dakota.

dinofact.Name: Daspletosaurus
dinofact.Description: This "frightful lizard" was a close cousin of T. Rex.

dinofact.Name: Datousaurus
dinofact.Description: A medium-sized sauropod from middle Jurassic Asia.

dinofact.Name: Echinodon
dinofact.Description: One of the few ornithopods to sport a set of canines.

dinofact.Name: Eustreptospondylus
dinofact.Description: A close cousin of Megalosaurus.

dinofact.Name: Fabrosaurus
dinofact.Description: This early ornithopod may have been a species of Lesothosaurus.

dinofact.Name: Falcarius
dinofact.Description: A bizarre, feathered theropod from North America.

dinofact.Name: Ferganasaurus
dinofact.Description: The first dinosaur ever to be discovered in the USSR.

dinofact.Name: Fruitadens
dinofact.Description: One of the tiniest dinosaurs ever to live in North America.

dinofact.Name: Fukuiraptor
dinofact.Description: One of the few carnivorous dinosaurs ever to be dug up in Japan.

dinofact.Name: Fukuisaurus
dinofact.Description: This ornithopod was discovered in Japan.

dinofact.Name: Gallimimus
dinofact.Description: This "chicken mimic" roamed the plains of the late Cretaceous.

dinofact.Name: Guanlong
dinofact.Description: Probably the first tyrannosaur ever to walk the earth.

dinofact.Name: Hadrosaurus
dinofact.Description: The official state dinosaur of New Jersey.

dinofact.Name: Hypselospinus
dinofact.Description: It was once classified as a species of Iguanodon.

dinofact.Name: Hypsibema
dinofact.Description: The official state dinosaur of Missouri.

dinofact.Name: Hypsilophodon
dinofact.Description: This man-sized herbivore liked to eat and run.

dinofact.Name: Ichthyovenator
dinofact.Description: This sail-backed dinosaur was recently discovered in Laos.

dinofact.Name: Ignavusaurus
dinofact.Description: Its name means "cowardly lizard".

dinofact.Name: Iguanacolossus
dinofact.Description: A brand-new ornithopod from North America.

dinofact.Name: Jainosaurus
dinofact.Description: Named after the Indian paleontologist Sohan Lal Jain.

dinofact.Name: Janenschia
dinofact.Description: The earliest titanosaur in the fossil record.

dinofact.Name: Jaxartosaurus
dinofact.Description: A poorly known hadrosaur from central Asia.

dinofact.Name: Kaatedocus
dinofact.Description: This Diplodocus relative had a characteristic grin.

dinofact.Name: Kaijiangosaurus
dinofact.Description: This might have been the same dinosaur as Gasosaurus.

dinofact.Name: Labocania
dinofact.Description: It may or may not have been a true tyrannosaur.

dinofact.Name: Lagosuchus
dinofact.Description: Could this have been the ancestor of all the dinosaurs?

dinofact.Name: Lambeosaurus
dinofact.Description: This duck-billed dinosaur had a hatchet-shaped crest on its noggin.

dinofact.Name: Lapparentosaurus
dinofact.Description: This sauropod was discovered in Madagascar.

dinofact.Name: Nankangia
dinofact.Description: A recently discovered oviraptor from China.

dinofact.Name: Nanosaurus
dinofact.Description: This "tiny lizard" was named by Othniel C. Marsh.

dinofact.Name: Ojoceratops
dinofact.Description: A very close relative of Triceratops.

dinofact.Name: Olorotitan
dinofact.Description: One of the most complete dinosaur fossils ever found in Russia.

dinofact.Name: Omeisaurus
dinofact.Description: One of the most common Chinese sauropods.

dinofact.Name: Oohkotokia
dinofact.Description: Its name is Blackfoot for "large stone".

dinofact.Name: Pachycephalosaurus
dinofact.Description: This plant-eater gave new meaning to the word "blockhead".

dinofact.Name: Pampadromaeus
dinofact.Description: This "Pampas runner" was ancestral to sauropods.

dinofact.Name: Pamparaptor
dinofact.Description: This raptor was discovered in the Argentinian Pampas.

dinofact.Name: Qantassaurus
dinofact.Description: Named after the national airline of Australia.

dinofact.Name: Qianzhousaurus
dinofact.Description: This long-snouted tyrannosaur has been nicknamed Pinocchio Rex.

dinofact.Name: Qiaowanlong
dinofact.Description: An Asian relative of Brachiosaurus.

dinofact.Name: Qiupalong
dinofact.Description: This "bird mimic" dinosaur was recently discovered in China.

dinofact.Name: Quaesitosaurus
dinofact.Description: This titanosaur may have had remarkably sharp hearing.

dinofact.Name: Quilmesaurus
dinofact.Description: This dinosaur was named after an indigenous South American tribe.

dinofact.Name: Rahiolisaurus
dinofact.Description: This Indian dinosaur is represented by seven tangled individuals.

dinofact.Name: Rahonavis
dinofact.Description: Was it a raptor-like bird or a bird-like raptor?

dinofact.Name: Sahaliyania
dinofact.Description: This hadrosaur's name is Manchurian for "black".

dinofact.Name: Saichania
dinofact.Description: This ankylosaur's name is Chinese for "beautiful".

dinofact.Name: Tachiraptor
dinofact.Description: The first meat-eating dinosaur ever to be discovered in Venezuela.

dinofact.Name: Talarurus
dinofact.Description: This ankylosaur was discovered in the Gobi Desert.
